citeinfo.title: Monthly Manual Hydrologic Monitoring Data for Disney Wilderness Preserve, Florida
Consequences and Correlates of Fire in Wetlands -- JFSP 01-1-3-09 {43FDCF46-8CA2-4FF6-8561-1DF571136A95}

descript.abstract: Water level data are collected monthly, by hand, in a subset of 448 wells. These are shallow (~15' deep) groundwater wells, 2" diameter.
descript.purpose: To measure hydrologic regimes of restored wetland systems.
descript.supplinf: The Disney Wilderness Preserve (DWP) in Osceola and Polk counties, Florida. Approximate bounding coordinates N: Lat 28.145 Long -81.439; S: Lat 28.029 Long -81.406; E: Lat 28.074 Long -81.373; W: Lat 28.129 Long -81.457

spdom.descgeog: Disney Wilderness Preserve in Osceola and Polk counties, Florida

idinfo.accconst: Requests for data should be directed to the DWP Research Coordinator. Data will be provided in electronic format.
idinfo.useconst: Any reports or publications presenting or referring to these datasets must be approved by the DWP Research Coordinator prior to publication.

cntinfo.cntinst: direct inquiries to the DWP Research Coordinator. As of 05/19/2005, this is Sandy Woiak.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.0.0.535

citeinfo.title: Consequences and Correlates of Fire in Wetlands -- JFSP 01-1-3-09 {43FDCF46-8CA2-4FF6-8561-1DF571136A95}

dataqual.complete: Data are keyed electronically in the field, to avoid transcription errors. Data manager checks data by graphing well data from proximate locations together to determine if the relationship of the water levels from these locations makes sense in lieu of previous months' data. For readings that appear anomalous, the location is rechecked within a week of the original reading to either confirm or replace the original datum. A second check occurs later, wherein a single location's datapoints are graphed over time and visually compared to nearby locations, and anomalous readings are eliminated from the dataset.

enttyp.enttypl: Monthly manual hydrologic monitoring data for Disney Wilderness Preserve
enttyp.enttypd: Water level data are collected monthly, by hand, in a subset of 448 wells.
enttyp.enttypds: The Nature Conservancy, Disney Wilderness Preserve

attr.attrdefs: The Nature Conservancy, Disney Wilderness Preserve

attr.attrdef: Water level inside of well pipe set to feet-NGVD. 8888 means no data. 9999 means well was dry inside.
attr.attrdefs: The Nature Conservancy, Disney Wilderness Preserve

attr.attrdef: Water level outside of well pipe set to feet-NGVD. 8888 means no data. 9999 means water was below ground.
attr.attrdefs: The Nature Conservancy, Disney Wilderness Preserve
The Nature Conservancy, Disney Wilderness Preserve

attr.attrdef: A unique number for each well comprised of: Hydrologic Unit, Transect Number, Well Number (meter distance along transect)
